content: Housing estate in Queenstown, Singapore **Buona Vista** is a housing estate located in the subzones of [one-north](/wiki/One-north) and Holland Drive in the residential township of [Queenstown](/wiki/Queenstown,_Singapore) in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). The housing estate is served by the [Buona Vista MRT station](/wiki/Buona_Vista_MRT_station) which links it up with the [MRT system](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)). It also has a [bus terminal](/wiki/Buona_Vista_Bus_Terminal). ## History The Buona Vista estate was developed by the [Housing and Development Board](/wiki/Housing_and_Development_Board) in the early 1970s as the neighbourhood 6 of Queenstown. The first flats (at Holland Close and Holland Avenue) were balloted on 10 July 1973 under the Home Ownership for the People Scheme. ## Geography The Buona Vista estate is centred around Holland Close, Holland Avenue and Holland Drive. It is close to the [Dover](/wiki/Dover,_Singapore) and [Ghim Moh](/wiki/Ghim_Moh) estates, and [Holland Village](/wiki/Holland_Village,_Singapore). It shares its name with North Buona Vista Road and South Buona Vista Road, which together is a hilly winding road that navigates through [Kent Ridge](/wiki/Kent_Ridge). ## Political history Buona Vista is currently under the jurisdiction of [Tanjong Pagar Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_Group_Representation_Constituency) as of 2025 under the namesake Buona Vista and Telok Blangah divisions. The Buona Vista division, which formerly belonged to Holland-Bukit Timah GRC until 2011, which includes Holland Drive and [Holland Village](/wiki/Holland_Village,_Singapore), is helmed by the current [Minister of Education](/wiki/Minister_for_Education_(Singapore)) [Chan Chun Sing](/wiki/Chan_Chun_Sing). The Telok Blangah division, which previously being a part of [West Coast Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/West_Coast_Group_Representation_Constituency), was helmed by [Rachel Ong](/wiki/Rachel_Ong). ## Sources - Victor R Savage, Brenda S A Yeoh (2003), *Toponymics - A Study of Singapore Street Names*, Eastern Universities Press, [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 981-210-205-1 1°18′26″N 103°47′26″E﻿ / ﻿1.3072°N 103.7906°E﻿ / 1.3072; 103.7906 This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub.
